Articles.Content:
Dear Sirs.

EXPERIMENT:

A few minutes ago I used my fan to push the wall of my room of 4 cubic meters.

RESULT:

The fan created a force against the wall in front of it. And I placed me on the other wall of back with a thread on the hands and not felt force of brake.

CONCLUSION:

I invented the propellant of System Closed "VEEG-BOX-HOUSE-1".

RECOMMENDATIONS:

They can be used other instruments stronger that a fan of House.

GRAPH OF THE PERFORMED EXPERIMENT TODAY 22 JANUARY 2014:

Very affectionately,

Victor Elias Espinoza Guedez

T.S.U. in computer science

January 22, 2014

If I understand his experiment correctly, blowing a fan against a wall generated a force that pushed against him in the opposite direction?

Impressive. Most impressive.
Why does all your stuff involve fans, and boxes.

If I understand his experiment correctly, blowing a fan against a wall generated a force that pushed against him in the opposite direction?

Impressive. Most impressive.

The force of the breeze is stronger.

" And I placed me on the other wall of back with a thread on the hands and not felt force of brake."

... What?

" And I placed me on the other wall of back with a thread on the hands and not felt force of brake."

... What?

There is no breeze to the rear.
In a nutshell, he thinks that a closed box with a fan in it is going to move. Which is really rather sad. Also, annoying. Can the mods at least take away his ability to start new threads?

In a nutshell, he thinks that a closed box with a fan in it is going to move. Which is really rather sad. Also, annoying. Can the mods at least take away his ability to start new threads?

In space if it moves.

The force of the breeze is stronger.

the farce of the fart you mean?
His posts do have comedic value, but this is getting ridiculous.

the farce of the fart you mean?

I did an experiment with a fan hung a rope. And the fan is movimo forward because had a lid. The force of the breeze from a fan is more strong.

You know what this could be improved with some nukes, orion it up!

Ok just kidding. I do love it that people think they can break the rules of thermodynamics.

This is bordering on trolling, is definitely spamming, and ticks the conspiracy theory/pseudo-science woo box as well.

Closing.
